children: The risk of HIV transmission is essentially zero in patients who have a sustained, undetectable viral load for at least 6 months (Undetectable = Untransmittable), so monogamous, serodifferent partners do not require further HIV prevention measures.
No additional prevention strategy is necessary (

). Persons with HIV infection who have at least 6 months of sustained viral suppression have effectively no risk of sexually transmitting HIV to HIV-negative partners. A large multicenter, observational study of HIV serodiscordant couples (including same-sex and heterosexual couples) showed no transmissions of HIV during condomless sex from effectively treated HIV-positive to HIV-negative partners. Several other studies have similarly shown that HIV-positive persons with sustained viral suppression do not transmit HIV to their sexual partners. U = U has been particularly endorsed to minimize stigma around HIV, and it is encouraged that physicians involved in the care of persons with HIV share this important update with their patients.
